intro: Globba timorensis, commonly known as the Timor globba, is a herbaceous plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers, and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features narrow, sword-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pale yellow to white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
